channel.title: Brisbane CBD Bicycle User Group (BUG)
channel.description: Recent content on Brisbane CBD Bicycle User Group (BUG)

item.title: Sister BUGs
item.description:
Sister BUGs

Not in the Brisbane CBD?

Check out our sister BUGs and other cycling advocacy groups we support and work with in Brisbane:

item.title: Petitions
item.description:
Petitions

Name of Petition Level of Government Link to Petition
Make Dickson Street safer for cycling Brisbane City Council View/Sign the Petition!
Request for Speed Limit Review of Annerley Road Brisbane City Council View/Sign the Petition!

item.title: Misuse of Bus Lanes / Jump Zones
item.description:
Why we are concerned?

The Brisbane Central Business District Bicycle User Group (CBD BUG) is concerned about the ongoing misuse of bus lanes and jump zones by private motorists, which significantly diminishes the benefits of these spaces for cyclists and public transport users. Despite the legal allowance for cyclists to use bus lanes, many drivers ignore this and obstruct the lanes, undermining their intended purpose. Although occasional police enforcement is carried out, it is insufficient to deter this widespread issue due to limited resources. The group is requesting the installation of camera surveillance technology to automatically detect and penalize motorists who violate the rules, particularly in the inner city.

item.title: How to Cycle with your Dog!
item.description:
How to Cycle with Your Dog and the Benefits of Cycling Together

Cycling with your dog can be a fun and rewarding experience, offering both of you exercise, fresh air, and bonding time. However, ensuring safety and comfort for both you and your furry companion is key. In this article, weâ€™ll cover how to cycle with your dog safely and the many benefits of doing so.

item.title: Adam Morrow
item.description:
Hi,

I’m Adam.

I live in inner city Brisbane and want to improve the cycling and walking infrastructrure in the inner city! Safer streets are betetr for everyone!
